world.description: Dust motes dance in the weak torchlight that cuts through the oppressive gloom of the Crumbling Crypts of Xylos. Once a magnificent tomb for a forgotten sorcerer-king, the crypts have long since fallen into ruin, their stone halls choked with debris and infested with creatures of the dark. Cobwebs hang like tattered banners from vaulted ceilings, and the air is thick with the smell of damp earth and something faintly, disturbingly sweet. Every shadow seems to writhe with unseen life, and the silence is broken only by the drip, drip, drip of unseen water and the adventurer's own ragged breath.

player.name: Kael
player.appearanceDescription: The newcomer stands lean and wiry, clad in practical, well-worn leather armor that has seen better days. A faded, dark blue scarf is tied loosely around their neck, offering a splash of muted color against the muted tones of their attire. Their short, dark hair is unkempt, framing a face that bears the subtle markings of someone accustomed to hard work and long journeys. Their eyes, sharp and observant, constantly scan their surroundings.
player.personalityDescription: Kael is a pragmatist, quick to assess situations and prioritize survival. They are not overly talkative, preferring action to words, but possess a sharp wit and a surprisingly dry sense of humor that surfaces in tense moments. While independent and self-reliant, they are not entirely without empathy, though they tend to express it through deeds rather than declarations.

playerLocation.description: Kael stands in the Collapsed Vestibule, the heavy, iron-banded wooden door to the south now slightly ajar behind them. The air here is still thick with dust, but a faint, cool draft suggests a connection to the outside world.

rooms.name: The Collapsed Vestibule
rooms.shortDescription: You are in a dusty, ruined chamber lit by a single torch.
rooms.longDescription: You find yourself in a roughly circular chamber, constructed from massive, uneven blocks of stone. The air is heavy with the scent of dust and decay. Faint, flickering light emanates from a single, sputtering torch set in a rusty bracket on the west wall, casting long, dancing shadows that play tricks on the eyes. Cobwebs, thick as felt, drape from the high, arched ceiling, and the floor is a mess of fallen stones and grit. In the center of the room, a pile of recently disturbed rubble suggests a recent collapse or excavation. Passages lead off in several directions: a grand, arched doorway to the north, a narrow, jagged opening to the south, and a more natural-looking fissure to the east.

rooms.name: Antechamber of the Forgotten King
rooms.shortDescription: A dimly lit antechamber with a large sarcophagus.
rooms.longDescription: This chamber appears to be an antechamber to the main burial vault. A massive stone sarcophagus dominates the center of the room, its lid slightly ajar, revealing only darkness within. Faded murals adorn the walls, depicting scenes of arcane rituals and a fallen king. To the north, a sturdy wooden door is set into the stone. To the east, a narrow, rubble-strewn passage seems to descend further into the earth.

rooms.name: The Prisoner's Despair
rooms.longDescription: A small, dank cell. The walls are slick with a foul-smelling slime, and the floor is littered with gnawed bones and fragments of rusted chains. A narrow, barred opening high on the west wall suggests a former use as a prison or holding area. To the south, the only apparent exit, a dark, narrow crack in the wall offers a desperate means of escape, or perhaps entry.

rooms.name: The Whispering Chasm
rooms.shortDescription: A vast cavern bisected by a perilous chasm.
rooms.longDescription: This cavernous space is dominated by a chasm of indeterminate depth, its darkness absolute and its chill palpable. A rickety, rope bridge, frayed and ancient, spans the gap, swaying precariously in an unseen breeze. On the far side, barely visible in the gloom, are the remnants of what might have been a ritualistic altar. To the west, the path from which you came. To the east, a sheer drop into oblivion.

rooms.name: Corridor of Faded Markings
rooms.shortDescription: A corridor with ancient markings on the walls.
rooms.longDescription: This corridor stretches northwards, carved with surprising precision from the solid rock. The walls are smooth, hinting at a time when this place was not yet forgotten. Faint, ethereal markings, almost like faded tattoos, can be seen etched into the stone, their purpose lost to time. The air here is slightly less stale than in the antechamber, carrying a whisper of a dry, ancient scent, like desiccated parchment. The corridor continues onward, disappearing into the deeper darkness. To the south, the sturdy wooden door provides a passage back to the antechamber.

rooms.name: Descending Passageway
rooms.shortDescription: A narrow, rubble-strewn passage that slopes downwards.
rooms.longDescription: This narrow passage slopes downwards, choked with loose stones and debris that crunch underfoot with every step. The walls are rough and unworked, a stark contrast to the smoother stonework found elsewhere. The descent is steep, and the darkness here seems to cling more tightly, amplifying the feeling of isolation. A faint, metallic tang hangs in the air, mingled with the pervasive smell of damp earth. The passage continues its downward trek, vanishing into oppressive blackness. The way back, to the antechamber, lies to the west.

items.name: Rubble
items.shortDescription: A large pile of rubble from a recent collapse.
items.appearanceDescription: A large pile of stone fragments and splintered wooden beams, clearly the result of a recent collapse. Some of the larger stones are jagged and sharp, while the wooden beams are brittle and coated in thick dust. Smaller pieces of debris are scattered across the floor around the main heap.

items.name: Dust and Grit
items.shortDescription: The floor is covered in dust and grit.
items.appearanceDescription: The floor is uneven and gritty, covered in a thick layer of dust and small fragments of stone. It appears to have been disturbed in places, possibly by the collapse.

items.name: Jagged Opening
items.shortDescription: A narrow, jagged opening in the southern wall.
items.appearanceDescription: A narrow opening in the southern wall, roughly hewn from the rock. The edges are jagged and sharp, suggesting a recent tear or break rather than a constructed passage.

items.name: Fissure
items.shortDescription: A natural-looking fissure in the eastern wall.
items.appearanceDescription: A fissure in the eastern wall, appearing more like a natural crack in the stone than a purposefully made passageway. It is partially obscured by shadows.

items.name: Cobwebs
items.shortDescription: Thick cobwebs hang from the ceiling.
items.appearanceDescription: Thick, grey strands of cobweb hang like tattered shrouds from the high, vaulted ceiling, catching the meager light of the torch and casting further shadows.

items.name: Sarcophagus
items.shortDescription: A massive, ancient stone sarcophagus rests in the center of the room.
items.appearanceDescription: A massive stone sarcophagus rests in the center of the chamber, its lid slightly askew, hinting at its age and the mysteries it might contain. The stone is dark and appears to be intricately carved with faded hieroglyphs that speak of forgotten royalty.

items.name: Faded Murals
items.shortDescription: Faded murals depicting arcane rituals cover the walls.
items.appearanceDescription: Faded, yet intricate murals cover the stone walls, depicting a sequence of arcane rituals. In these scenes, robed figures gather around a central, regal figure, presumably the forgotten king, as they perform complex magical rites. The colors are muted, but the ghostly outlines of the images are still discernible.

items.name: Sturdy Wooden Door
items.shortDescription: A sturdy wooden door reinforced with iron bands is set into the north wall.
items.appearanceDescription: This sturdy wooden door is reinforced with thick bands of dark, aged iron. It appears to be ancient but well-constructed, set firmly into the stone northern wall.

items.name: Rubble-Strewn Passage
items.shortDescription: A narrow passage filled with rubble leads east, descending further into the earth.
items.appearanceDescription: A narrow passage, choked with loose stones and debris, descends into the earth. The opening is rough and appears unstable, hinting at further dangers below.

items.name: Dense Cobwebs
items.shortDescription: A thick, sticky mass of cobwebs covers part of the south wall.
items.appearanceDescription: A pile of particularly thick and resilient cobwebs clings to the southern wall, far denser than those seen elsewhere. They seem almost woven, forming a sticky, grey tapestry.

itemLocations.description: Kael holds the sputtering torch in their right hand, its flickering light casting dancing shadows on the surrounding debris.

In the approximate center of the Collapsed Vestibule, this significant pile of rubble occupies a large portion of the floor space. It appears to have recently fallen from the ceiling or one of the walls, creating a substantial obstacle and obscuring whatever might lie beneath.
The floor of the Collapsed Vestibule is entirely covered by dust and small stone fragments.
This jagged opening is located in the southern wall of the chamber, offering a cramped and uncertain path forward.
Located in the eastern wall of the Collapsed Vestibule, this fissure seems to be a natural formation.
Draped from the vaulted ceiling of the Collapsed Vestibule, these cobwebs extend across large swathes of the upper chamber.

The sarcophagus is positioned squarely in the middle of the Antechamber of the Forgotten King, its imposing form a central feature of the room. It lies parallel to the northern and southern walls, with its head oriented towards the north wall.
The murals adorn the entirety of the circular stone walls of the Antechamber of the Forgotten King, encircling the central sarcophagus. They stretch from the floor to the arched ceiling.
The northern wall of the Antechamber of the Forgotten King features this sturdy wooden door. It is set flush with the stone, its heavy iron bands catching the torchlight.
The eastern wall of the Antechamber of the Forgotten King conceals this narrow, rubble-strewn passage. It is partially obscured by shadows and the general detritus of the crypts.
Draped heavily across the lower section of the southern wall in the Antechamber of the Forgotten King, these cobwebs form a dense barrier against the stone.

roomConnections.descriptionOfPathFromRoom1ToRoom2: A sturdy wooden door, set with thick iron bands, is visible to the north, connecting to what appears to be an antechamber.
roomConnections.descriptionOfPathFromRoom2ToRoom1: A heavy, iron-banded wooden door, slightly ajar, leads from this antechamber into a preceding area.

roomConnections.descriptionOfPathFromRoom1ToRoom2: A narrow, jagged fissure in the south wall of this dusty crypt opens into a cramped, slime-coated cell.
roomConnections.descriptionOfPathFromRoom2ToRoom1: From the darkness within the cell, one can see a small, crudely carved opening in the wall that seems to lead into a more open, though still dimly lit, passage.

roomConnections.descriptionOfPathFromRoom1ToRoom2: To the east, a natural fissure in the crypt wall leads to a vast, echoing cavern that plunges into a seemingly bottomless chasm, spanned only by a fragile-looking rope bridge.
roomConnections.descriptionOfPathFromRoom2ToRoom1: The rough-hewn passage opens onto a dizzying precipice. A perilous rope bridge stretches across the expanse, leading into the darkness beyond.

roomConnections.descriptionOfPathFromRoom1ToRoom2: To the north, beyond the now-cleared cobwebs and the sturdy wooden door, a well-traveled path beckons.
roomConnections.descriptionOfPathFromRoom2ToRoom1: The sturdy wooden door to the south leads back to the familiar gloom of the Antechamber of the Forgotten King.

roomConnections.descriptionOfPathFromRoom1ToRoom2: To the east, a rubble-strewn passage descends, promising further exploration into the depths.
roomConnections.descriptionOfPathFromRoom2ToRoom1: The passage to the west leads back up, out of the rubble and into the Antechamber of the Forgotten King.

Kael finds themselves standing back in the antechamber, the southern door now slightly ajar behind them, a faint, cool draft hinting at a passage beyond.

Kael thrusts the sputtering torch forward, bringing the flame into contact with the thick cobwebs. The ancient, dry material catches fire with surprising speed, the flames crackling and spreading rapidly upwards, consuming the cobwebs in a brief, bright inferno.
